page.title: 17Worth Valley Railway (cont.)
page.content: test before they can drive the trains. The society raises money from fares, entrance fees to the goods yards,the shop and buffet.British Rail inspect the engines to check that they are safe and often sell them old engines for use as spare parts. The society has become another great source of interest in{Haworth, running steam trains every weekend throughout the year with an annual 130,000 visitors from all over the world.Many of the 30 locomotives owned by the{Worth Valley Railway}are nearly 100 years old and require special maintenance which is costly since parts are not available and must be made to order.Films such as "The Railway Children" and "Yanks" have been made using the line,increasing its worldwide renown.
